quotes.quote: Every great warrior must learn to endure and overcome the adversities of life.
A warrior takes responsibility for his acts, for the most trivial of acts. An average man acts out his thoughts, and never takes responsibility for what he does.
A warrior must only take care that his spirit is never broken.
A warrior thinks of death when things become unclear. The idea of death is the only thing that tempers our spirit.
There is no greater warrior than a mother protecting her child.
The path of the Warrior is lifelong, and mastery is often simply staying on the path.
Some Warriors look fierce, but are mild. Some seem timid, but are vicious. Look beyond appearances; position yourself for the advantage.
A warrior does not give up what he loves, he finds the love in what he does.
The warrior's intention should be simply to grasp his sword and to die.
Courage, above all things, is the first quality of a warrior.
Warriors do not win victories by beating their heads against walls, but by overtaking the walls. Warriors jump over walls; they don't demolish them
The two most powerful warriors are patience and time.
A warrior of light who trusts too much in his intelligence will end up underestimating the power of his opponent.
Ideas are the great warriors of the world, and a war that has no idea behind it, is simply a brutality.
To be a warrior is to learn to be genuine in every moment of your life.
The art of being a warrior is to balance the wonder and the terror of being alive.
The true warrior understands and seizes that moment by giving an effort so intense and so intuitive that it could only be called one from the heart.
He who conquers himself is the mightiest warrior.
And, though the warrior's sun has set, Its light shall linger round us yet, Bright, radiant, blest.
The average man is hooked to his fellow men, while the warrior is hooked only to infinity.
All men are warriors. And life for everything in our universe is nothing but war.
Great warriors, like great earthquakes, are principally remembered for the mischief they have done.
Warriors should suffer their pain silently.
A warrior acts as if he knows what he is doing, when in effect he knows nothing.
As a peaceful warrior, I would choose when, where and how I would behave. With that commitment, I began to live the life of a warrior.
Warriors do not argur, but they take decisions.
The manhood does not make a man, but warriors were born by it.
